Package utility

Class IO

java.lang.Object
utility.IO
public final class IO
extends java.lang.Object
This class comprises static methods used for reading and writing files.
Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

    • getLinesFromFile

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLinesFromFile​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Reads a file and returns its content line-wise as list.
      Parameters:
      filePath - String representing a file path.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of String objects, each representing one line of the file accessed via the passed file path.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the specified file path does not lead to any file.

    • getInputFromEagerOutput

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getInputFromEagerOutput​(java.lang.String outputDirectory)
      Scans an EAGER output directory for .vcf files and returns, for each sample, the sample name and .vcf files path.
      Parameters:
      outputDirectory - String specifying an EAGER output directory.
      Returns:
      A size two array containing two ArrayList objects, the first comprising the .vcf file paths and the second comprising the sample names.

    • readGFF

      public static org.biojava.nbio.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList readGFF​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Reads a .gff file from the path specified by a File object and returns a FeatureList object.
      Parameters:
      file - File specifying a .gff file.
      Returns:
      FeatureList comprising the entries from the read .gff file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the GFF3Reader throws any IOException.

    • readFasta

      public static java.util.HashSet<FastaEntry> readFasta​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Reads a .fasta file from a File object into a HashSet of FastaEntry instances. Each element contains the header and sequence of the respective entry from the .fasta file.
      Parameters:
      file - File specifying a .fasta file.
      Returns:
      HashSet of FastaEntry instances.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the respective file can not be found or accessed.

      Throws:

    • generateFile

      public static void generateFile​(java.io.File file) throws MusialIOException
      Tries to generate the file specified by the passed File object.
      Parameters:
      file - File object representing a file.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the file could not be generated.

    • writeSnvTable

      public static void writeSnvTable​(java.io.File outFile, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, VariablePositionsTable variablePositionsTable, boolean addReference) throws MusialIOException
      Writes output `.tsv` file containing nucleotide variants in a tab delimited format.

      The expected output format is: Position \t Reference (optional) \t [SAMPLE_1_NAME] \t ... x (Integer) \t [Nucleotide at position x in reference] (optional) \t [Nucleotide at position x in sample 1] \t ...

      Parameters:
      outFile - File instance pointing to the output file.
      referenceAnalysisId - String internal reference feature identifier of which the output is written.
      variablePositionsTable - VariablePositionsTable instance containing variant information.
      addReference - Boolean whether reference information should be added.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the output file could not be generated or not written to.

    • writeSequenceAlignment

      public static void writeSequenceAlignment​(java.io.File outFile, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, VariablePositionsTable variablePositionsTable, boolean addReference) throws MusialIOException
      Writes output `.fasta` file containing the full length sequences of all samples and the reference (optional).
      Parameters:
      outFile - File instance pointing to the output file.
      referenceAnalysisId - String internal reference feature identifier of which the output is written.
      variablePositionsTable - VariablePositionsTable instance containing variant information.
      addReference - Boolean whether reference information should be added.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the output file could not be generated or not written to.

    • writeVariantAlignment

      public static void writeVariantAlignment​(java.io.File outFile, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, VariablePositionsTable variablePositionsTable, boolean addReference) throws MusialIOException
      Writes output `.fasta` file containing the sequence of variants of all samples and the reference (optional).
      Parameters:
      outFile - File instance pointing to the output file.
      referenceAnalysisId - String internal reference feature identifier of which the output is written.
      variablePositionsTable - VariablePositionsTable instance containing variant information.
      addReference - Boolean whether reference information should be added.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the output file could not be generated or not written to.

    • writeSampleStatistics

      public static void writeSampleStatistics​(java.io.File outFile, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, VariablePositionsTable variablePositionsTable) throws MusialIOException
      Writes a `.tsv` file containing per sample statistics.
      Parameters:
      outFile - File instance pointing to the output file.
      referenceAnalysisId - String internal reference feature identifier of which the output is written.
      variablePositionsTable - VariablePositionsTable instance containing variant information.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the output file could not be generated or not written to.

    • writePositionStatistics

      public static void writePositionStatistics​(java.io.File outFile, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, VariablePositionsTable variablePositionsTable) throws MusialIOException
      Writes a `.tsv` file containing per position statistics.

      One row contains information about the counts of each possible variant content (see VariablePosition)

      Parameters:
      outFile - File instance pointing to the output file.
      referenceAnalysisId - String internal reference feature identifier of which the output is written.
      variablePositionsTable - VariablePositionsTable instance containing variant information.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the output file could not be generated or not written to.

    • writeSnvAnnotations

      public static void writeSnvAnnotations​(java.io.File outFile, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, VariablePositionsTable variablePositionsTable) throws MusialIOException
      Writes output `.tsv` file containing annotations in a tab delimited format.

      The expected output format is: Position \t [SAMPLE_1_NAME] \t ... x (Integer) \t [Quality,Coverage,...] \t ...

      Parameters:
      outFile - File instance pointing to the output file.
      referenceAnalysisId - String internal reference feature identifier of which the output is written.
      variablePositionsTable - VariablePositionsTable instance containing variant information.
      Throws:
      MusialIOException - If the output file could not be generated or not written to.

      variablePositionsTable -
